content: You can modify the "View Film Details" button's `href` attribute to point to the "filmDetails.html" page and pass the `searchResults` data as a query parameter. You can do this by changing the `href` attribute value like this: ```php View Film Details ``` In the `filmDetails.html` page, you can access the query parameter using JavaScript's `URLSearchParams` API and parse the JSON data. ```javascript const urlParams = new URLSearchParams(window.location.search); const searchResults = JSON.parse(urlParams.get("searchResults")); ``` You can then use the `searchResults` variable to display the details on the "filmDetails.html" page.
